page.title: 05POPULATION CHARACTERISTICS
page.content: The 1981 Census showed that in the Enumeration Districts covering East Meon and Langrish there was a total population of about 1300.The sexes were evenly balanced with slightly more females.Of these,about half were married.Approximately 25% of the population consisted of children aged under 16 and nearly as many - about 22% - were aged 60 or over,of whom about 80 were retired males. The 2 biggest age groups were firstly children aged 10-14,of whom there were about 125 and secondly the group of adults aged 30-34,of whom there were about 110.The numbers in the older age groups showed a general decline,apart from the sudden and unexpected rise in numbers starting with the 50-54 age group.This reflects the fact that this area is popular with people seking somewhere to retire to.
